page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: EASTON MAUDIT DERIVES ITS NAME FROM ITS POSITION,EASTON="EAST FARM".IT IS A COMMON NAME AND TO IT WAS ADDED THE NAMEOF THE FAMILY WHO HELD THE MANOR, THE MAUDUITS.THEY WERE OF NORMAN-FRENCH ORIGIN,AND MAUDUIT WAS A NICKNAME(LATIN MALEDOCTUS=DUNCE.)THEY ACQUIRED THE LAND IN 1131.OTHER PEOPLE WHO HAVE OWNED THE AREA ARE THE YELVERTONS WHOSE DESCENDENTS BECAME EARL OF SUSSEX,AND THE COMPTON ESTATES(MARQUIS OF NORTHAMPTON). EASTON MAUDIT IS A HAMLET 2 MILES SOUTH OF BOZEAT.IT HAS A POPULATION OF 62.THE VILLAGE USED TO HAVE A SCHOOL,SHOP AND OUTDOOR BEER-HOUSE.THESE HAVE ALL GONE. IN THE CHURCH OF SS.PETER AND PAUL ARE BURIED THE 2nd AND 3rd.EARLS OF SUSSEX. THOMAS PERCY WAS VICAR 1753-1780.AMONG HIS FRIENDS WAS SAMUEL JOHNSON.THE IDEA OF THE GARRICK CLUB IN LONDON,WAS STARTED AT EASTON MAUDIT.
